subject: Research Position Application - Ruiming Kang
body:
Dear Professor Akinwande,

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Ruiming Kang, and I am a Mechanical Engineering student at the University of Texas at Austin, currently seeking research opportunities within your lab. I have a keen interest in materials engineering, particularly in advanced materials such as carbon nanotubes and graphene, which aligns closely with your research in 2D materials and nanotechnology.

I would greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss how my background and skills could contribute to your ongoing research. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the possibility of working together.

Best regards,

Ruiming Kang
Austin, TX | (469)-407-5201 | rkang@utexas.edu | ruimingkang.com

Dear Professor Akinwande,

I am writing to express my interest in joining your research team as a student researcher. Currently, I am pursuing my Mechanical Engineering degree at the University of Texas at Austin, with an anticipated graduation in 2027. My academic focus and hands-on experiences with advanced materials uniquely position me to contribute to your innovative work in 2D materials and nanotechnology.

During my time as a Student Researcher at the University of Texas at Dallas, I contributed to projects that involved noise reduction in automotive tires through the application of advanced materials like carbon nanotubes and graphene. This experience allowed me to strengthen my analytical skills, utilizing MATLAB for digital image correlation analysis and Python programming for data automation and visualization.

Additionally, my role as a TechLead in the University of Texas Chinese Students and Scholars Association honed my leadership and technical abilities. Leading a team to construct a responsive website and manage event software has equipped me with a robust problem-solving approach, excellent communication skills, and a thorough understanding of technical project needs.

I am excited about the prospect of working under your guidance and applying my knowledge in advanced materials to your cutting-edge research. I would be grateful for the opportunity to discuss how I can be a valuable addition to your team. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
Ruiming Kang
